title: Heat_Activity_Hotspots_Analysis_Melbourne
name: Heat-Activity Hotspots Analysis for Melbourne CBD and Surroundings
description: Comprehensive analysis of extreme heat events and pedestrian activity patterns in Melbourne CBD and its surroundings. This project includes data cleaning, exploratory analysis, geospatial clustering, temporal trends analysis, and strategic recommendations for implementing cooling interventions to improve public health and urban livability.

datasets.name: Microclimate Sensor Data
datasets.description: Dataset containing air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and other environmental metrics across Melbourne.

datasets.name: Pedestrian Counts Data
datasets.description: Hourly pedestrian activity data collected from sensors across Melbourne CBD and surrounding areas.

key_features: Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Addressed missing values and ensured consistency between environmental and pedestrian datasets.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyzed temperature and pedestrian patterns to uncover critical trends.
Heat-Activity Hotspot Identification: Used K-Means clustering to locate areas with extreme heat and high pedestrian activity.
Geospatial Analysis: Created interactive maps using Folium to visualize hotspots and intervention zones.
Temporal Trends Analysis: Examined hourly and seasonal variations in temperature and pedestrian counts.
Recommendations: Proposed actionable strategies, including shaded seating, hydration stations, misting systems, and urban greening for high-risk zones.
